title: Could clomiphene kindle acute manic episode in a male patient? A case report.
abstract: Psychiatric adverse effects associated with the use of clomiphene are relatively uncommon. Though case reports link mood swings to be associated with clomiphene, it is not known to be associated with a syndromal affective episode. Being a selective estrogen receptor modulator, clomiphene affects the hypothalamus-pituitary-gonadal axis and can have potential neuropsychiatric effects in vulnerable persons. Herein we report a case of clomiphene-induced manic episode in a known bipolar male patient.
